#Taurocholate Cycloserine Cefoxitin Fructose Agar
## Written by: Jhansi Leslie

In a 2L flask add 800mL of MilliQ water.  

And then add the following:

40g [Proteose Peptone #3](http://www.bdbiosciences.com/us/cell-culture/media-supplements/media-supplements/ao-animal-origin/porcine/proteose-peptone-no3/p/212220)
5g	[Na2HPO4  (sodium phosphate dibasic)] (http://www.sigmaaldrich.com/catalog/product/aldrich/255793?lang=en&region=US)
1g 	[KH2PO4  (potassium phosphate monobasic)] (http://www.sigmaaldrich.com/catalog/product/sigma/p9791?lang=en&region=US)
2g 	[NaCl] (http://www.sigmaaldrich.com/catalog/product/sigma/s3014?lang=en&region=US)
0.1g [MgSO4] (http://www.sigmaaldrich.com/catalog/product/sigald/m7506?lang=en&region=US)
6g 	[Fructose] (http://www.sigmaaldrich.com/catalog/product/sigma/f0127?lang=en&region=US)

Bring final volume to 1L
 
*If making agar add 20g bacto agar to the media  (I use select agar not bacto) 

Autoclave for 25min at liquid setting~

After the media has been autoclaved and cooled a bit, add the following: 

Add 10mL of 10% (w/v) taurocholate  (1g in 10mL water, filter sterilize) 

Add 25mL D-cycloserine (10mg/mL, filter sterilize)
	
Add  1.6 mL cefoxitin (10mg/mL, filter sterilize) 



Stir briefly and pour plates (1L of media should make about 45 plates). 

Note:  To cool media: place in a water bath set at 50C.
